note:
在大流行期间，成人内容和色情网站的业务唯一蓬勃发展，使其大多数拥有者成为新的亿万富翁 - 并提高对他过去的新担忧。
    2018年10月，基于佛罗里达州的互联网色情Baron Leonid Radvinsky，现在39次购买了75％的增长，而且很大程度上是闻所未闻的商业，称为众多商业。当时，伦敦的唯一义者是一个刚刚泼录的视频和社交网站，使成年表演者可以从自己的家庭中赚钱。 “内容创作者” - 主要是色情明星 - 通过公司的平台设置账户，向观众（公司称之为“粉丝”）的订阅费，其范围从每月49.99美元到49.99美元 - 而表演者保留80％收费。
 随着所有电影制作 - 成人或以其他方式 - 在大流行病和数百万孤独的人陷入困境，唯一只有商业蓬勃发展。在2020年11月到11月，唯一只有4亿美元的收入，比上年增长540％，其中80％来自美国客户。创造者的数量几乎夸大了160万，包括更多主流的明星，如Cardi B，DJ Khaled，Fat Joe和Rebecca Minkoff。支付风扇的总数增长超过500％至8200万。税后的利润从660万美元上升到6000万美元。福布斯估计，Radvinsky在Fenix International的股权 - 唯一的母公司 - 使他成为一个新的亿万富翁，价值约18亿美元。
  在这些令人讨厌的财务之外，这些资金在U.K.上发表，对Radvinsky知之甚少，他们没有回应重复的评论请求。唯一的代表也拒绝发表评论。
 我们所知，唯一的是，一位英国企业家在2016年成立，英国企业家在蒂莫西席卷，现在37，与他退休的银行家父亲，顽固，托马斯弟兄。在U.K.申请，Radvinsky和Guy股票上市被列为公司的唯一董事。 Timothy，Thomas和Guy Stokely都拒绝评论这个故事。
   别人对Radvinsky别人不那么讨人喜欢。在互联网色情制品之前，他曾担任过广告的网站上的一小帝国，以获取“非法”和“黑客”密码的一个小帝国，包括被广告为特色的未成年人表现者。在20世纪90年代后期，这种链接网站很常见，而且用于市场不仅仅是色情，而且在线赌博和其他灰色市场活动。
 但Radvinsky特别好。通过Wayback Machine的网站档案，福布斯揭开了11个这样的网站，所有这些网站都在20世纪90年代末和2000年代初创建的Radvinsky和他的Glenview，伊利诺伊州的业务，讯讯组织。它们包括密码Universe，2000年，该宇宙发布了将Web用户指向一个网址，该网站声称提供超过10,000个“非法前青少年密码”的网站。 1999年，一个名为工作通行证的网站对包含16岁儿童的“最炙手可热的铁杆”有一个链接。同样在2000年，另一个网站，超密码，承诺了一个包含“最佳非法青少年密码”和“网络上最热门的兽性网站”的链接。在美国的色情行动者的法定年龄是18岁，而兽性（与动物发生性关系的行为）在大多数美国国家是非法的。 （在与福布斯说话后，从中返回Radvinsky的旧网站删除了Radvinsky的旧网站。） 
但没有证据表明任何Radvinsky的网站都与儿童色情或兽性相关联。相反，这些网站似乎是Radvinsky通过为每次点击收取合作伙伴（实际色情网站）来赚钱的方式。禁止禁止访问此类图像，询问互联网观看基金会（IWF），一个专业集团从事Web上删除此类内容的专家组，以查看包含广告未成年色情内容的归档网页。根据IWF，没有与非法材料相关联。
  这是一个糟糕的业务，但这是一个有利可图的业务。 Radvinsky的网站之一在2002年的每天为5,000美元的收入，或者今年180万美元。
  相反，链接通常通过提供更多链接到免费的色情密码或其他成人内容的类似站点。 2002年，在Radvinsky毕业于西北大学前一年，他主修经济学，他的Cyber​​tania Sued域名注册商和互联网骨干提供商VeriSign，声称VeriSign将其中一个网站转移给其他人。在那种诉讼中，Radvinsky的公司表示，它与已声称拥有“黑客”登录的同一网站合作：“Cyber​​ ania为每个超级链接连接或密码获得了一笔钱，从各自所有者和运营商中使用那些推荐网站，“Cyber​​ an的律师写道。在另一个针对Radvinsky的诉讼中，原告指出，超密码“介绍了提供”被盗“（被盗）密码的欺骗性形象，以获取其他色情网站的免费服务，但实际上是一个有利可图的联盟推荐网站。”
  这是一个糟糕的业务，但这是一个有利可图的业务。 Radvinsky公司表示，在纽约州的威利尼亚诉讼中，Radvinsky的公司表示，其超密码网站在2002年的每天为5,000美元的收入，或者今年180万美元。
 Radvinsky在他的性联赛农场业务的开始和购买75％之间的近20年间难以难以捉摸。在2000年代初，他创建了一场与名人性爱胶带和MyFreecams的少数网站，该网站声称成为世界上的一个色情通媒体服务的网站。他偶尔也突然出现在诉讼中。 2003年和2004年，亚马逊和微软Sued Radvinsky在西雅图的美国地区法院，据称垃圾邮件活动，使用了亚马逊姓名和微软电子邮件工具，为成人网站提供了“来自政府的免费资金”或与成人网站的联系。 Radvinsky否认了所有的指控。案件于2005年签订法院，而Radvinsky及其业务被禁止在垃圾邮件中使用亚马逊姓名或使用任何Microsoft的电子邮件工具。他的讯连雪地人业务于2005年由一个模特，Sheila Lassier起诉，在他的一个色情网站上使用她（穿上的）形象，这是公司战斗的指控。 Lassier说她终止了一个未公开的金额。
 唯一的是未成年人表现者遇到自己的问题。由于该网站无法独立验证其性工作者的年龄，因此人们撒谎是相当容易的。 5月下旬，一名英国广播公司调查显示，一名14岁的女孩已经能够以祖母唯一使用她的祖母＆＃39;护照将一个账户注册为表演者。一名高级警察告诉英国广播公司，唯一的是“[n] ot这么做，以便制定防止儿童利用有机会生成金钱的儿童的保障措施，也是为了被剥削的儿童。＆＃34;作为回应，唯一签发了它的声明，即它使用“最先进的技术”和“人类监测”试图防止在平台上的18岁以下分享内容，并且非常认真的问题。
 Canadian儿童保护中心的助理执行主任Symery Arnason表示，她的团体经常收到关于唯一可能是未成年人的模型的通知。她唯一描述了保护未成年性能的努力为“最小”。唯一的是“在这里做得更好的道德和道德责任”，“她补充道。
note_en:
Business at the adult content and porn site OnlyFans has boomed during the pandemic, making its majority owner a new billionaire – and raising fresh concerns about his past.
    In October 2018, Florida-based internet porn baron Leonid Radvinsky, now 39, bought an estimated 75% of a growing but largely unheard-of business called OnlyFans. At the time, London-based OnlyFans was a fledgling video and social site that allowed adult performers to make money from the comfort of their own homes. “Content creators” – mostly porn stars — set up accounts via the company’s platform and charge a subscription fee to viewers (whom the company calls “fans”) that ranges from $4.99 to $49.99 a month —and the performers keep 80% of whatever they charge.
 With all film production – adult or otherwise – shuttered during the pandemic and millions of lonely people stuck at home, OnlyFans’ business has boomed. In the year through November 2020, OnlyFans posted revenues of $400 million, up 540% over the prior year, 80% of which came from American customers. The number of creators nearly quintupled to 1.6 million, including more mainstream stars like Cardi B, DJ Khaled, Fat Joe, and Rebecca Minkoff. The total number of paying fans rose more than 500% to 82 million. Profits after tax rose to $60 million from $6.6 million.  Forbes estimates that Radvinsky’s stake in Fenix International – OnlyFans’ parent company — makes him a new billionaire, worth some $1.8 billion.
  Outside of these eye-popping financials, which were published in the U.K., little is known about Radvinsky, who didn’t respond to repeated requests for comment. A representative for OnlyFans also declined to comment.
 We do know that OnlyFans was founded in 2016 by a British entrepreneur named Timothy Stokely, now 37, alongside his retired banker father, Guy Stokely, and brother Thomas. In U.K. filings, Radvinsky and Guy Stokely are listed as the company’s sole directors. Timothy, Thomas, and Guy Stokely all declined to comment for this story.
   What little else is known about Radvinsky is not flattering. Some twenty years ago, before Internet pornography was widely available for free, he ran a small empire of websites that advertised access to “illegal” and “hacked” passwords to porn sites, including ones that were advertised as featuring underage performers. In the late 1990s such link sites were common and were used to market not just pornography but online gambling and other grey market activities.
 But Radvinsky was particularly aggressive. Looking through the Wayback Machine’s website archive,  Forbes uncovered 11 such sites, all created in the late 1990s and early 2000s by Radvinsky and his Glenview, Illinois-based business, Cybertania. They included Password Universe, which, in 2000, published a link directing web users to a site claiming to offer pedophiles more than 10,000 “illegal pre-teen passwords.” In 1999, a site called Working Passes had a link for “the hottest underaged hardcore” containing 16-year-olds. Also in 2000, another site, Ultra Passwords, promised a link containing “the best illegal teen passwords” and “the hottest bestiality site on the web.” The legal age for porn actors in the U.S. is 18, while bestiality (the act of having sex with an animal) is illegal in most American states. (The Wayback Machine removed Radvinsky’s old websites from its archive after speaking to  Forbes.)
  But there’s no evidence that any of Radvinsky’s sites actually linked to child pornography or bestiality. Instead, the sites appear to have been a way for Radvinsky to earn money by charging his partners (actual porn sites) for every click.  Forbes, prohibited from accessing such imagery, asked the Internet Watch Foundation (IWF), a specialist group engaged in the removal of such content on the web, to look at archived webpages containing links advertising underage pornography. According to the IWF, none linked to illegal material.
  It was a scummy business, but it was a profitable one. One of Radvinsky’s sites was bringing in revenues of $5,000 a day in 2002, or $1.8 million for the year.
  Instead, the links typically went through to similar sites offering more links to free porn passwords or other adult content. In 2002, a year before Radvinsky graduated from Northwestern University, where he majored in economics, his company Cybertania sued domain name registrar and internet backbone provider Verisign, claiming that Verisign transferred one of its websites to someone else. In that suit, Radvinsky’s company said that it was in partnership with those same sites from which it had claimed to have “hacked” logins: “Cybertania earned a sum of money for each hyperlink connection or password, used from the respective owner and operators of those referral sites,” Cybertania’s lawyers wrote. In another lawsuit against Radvinsky, the plaintiff stated that Ultra Passwords “presents the deceptive image of providing ‘hacked’ (stolen) passwords to get free services from other pornographic sites, but which is in fact a lucrative affiliate referral site.”
  It was a scummy business, but it was a profitable one. In the Cybertania suit against Verisign, Radvinsky’s company said its Ultra Passwords site was bringing in revenues of $5,000 a day in 2002, or $1.8 million for the year.
 Radvinsky remained elusive during the nearly 20 years between the start of his sex link farm businesses and his purchase of 75% of OnlyFans. In the early 2000s, he created a handful of sites linking to celebrity sex tapes and MyFreeCams, a site that claims to be the world’s number one porn-via-webcam service. He has also occasionally popped up in lawsuits. In 2003 and 2004, Amazon and Microsoft sued Radvinsky in U.S. district court in Seattle for alleged spam campaigns that used the Amazon name and Microsoft email tools to offer spam recipients “free money from the government” or links to adult websites. Radvinsky denied all allegations. The cases were settled out of court in 2005, and Radvinsky and his businesses were barred from using Amazon’s name in spam or using any of Microsoft’s email tools . His Cybertania business was sued in 2005 by a model, Sheila Lussier, for using her (clothed) image on one of his porn sites, an allegation the company fought. Lussier says she settled for an undisclosed sum.
 OnlyFans has run into its own issues with underage performers. Since the site doesn’t independently verify its sex workers’ ages, it’s fairly easy for people to lie. In late May, a BBC investigation revealed that a 14-year-old girl had been able to register an account as a performer on OnlyFans using her grandmother's passport. A senior police officer told the BBC that OnlyFans is “[N]ot doing enough to put in place the safeguards that prevent children exploiting the opportunity to generate money, but also for children to be exploited." In response, OnlyFans issued a statement that it used “state-of-the-art technology” and “human monitoring” to try to prevent under-18s sharing content on the platform and it took the issue “very seriously.”
 Signy Arnason, associate executive director of The Canadian Center for Child Protection, says her group often receives notifications about OnlyFans’ models potentially being underage. She describes OnlyFans’ efforts to protect underage performers as “minimal.” OnlyFans has “a moral and ethical responsibility to be doing better here,” she adds.
title: Leonid Radvinsky，亿万富翁的唯一唯一的所有者，RAN网站的90年代推广“黑客”色情网站密码，包括有前途访问儿童色情的链接
title_en: Leonid Radvinsky, billionaire owner of OnlyFans, ran sites in the '90s promoting “hacked” porn site passwords, including links promising access to child porn

note:
夏洛特，N.c.，19日，2021年6月19日/ Prnewswire  -  Prweb /  - 作为国家首次准备庆祝JuneNth作为联邦假期，这是一个新的技术前沿为探索开放。 Fortune 500高级软件工程师Mardochee＆＃34; Mardix＆＃34; Macxis正在推出BlackDevhub.io，这是基于区块科技的第一个黑色社交和作业匹配网络。
 Blackdevhub.io提供了在科技和招聘组织中的黑人和非洲裔美国人，他们希望聘请一个分散的平台来构建社区，分享工作机会，并在仅由其用户的自由空间中创建新的应用程序;野心。
 BlackDevhub.io存在解决了一个真正的问题困扰技术产业：缺乏多样性。尽管对种族股权的历史兴趣和在各种各样的社会中纳入其中，但Tech的黑色代表仍然很低。在Facebook，Google，Microsoft和Twitter等领导科技公司，黑人只占3-6％的员工。而不是缺乏欲望 - 黑人对技术公司感兴趣，科技公司有兴趣雇用他们。他们只是不知道如何找到彼此。
  ＆＃34;我创建了blackdevhub.io级筹集场地，弥合了黑色人才与雇主之间的差距。 BlackDevhub.io在黑人人才和想要雇用他们的公司之间均匀地拆分，为寻求机会思想的社区和招聘经理提供安全，简化的平台，以列出职位，并与他们可能已经错过的令人难以置信的人才联系。我们可以等待查看我们的用户在BlackDevhub.io上完成的内容。＆＃34;
 BlackDevhub.io还使致力于多样性的组织更容易展示他们对世界的努力。凭借其区块链验证的多样性指数，BlackDevhub.io在技术雇用中排名财富500强公司。通过公司简介验证，社区成员可以轻松识别和联系致力于促进更大的包容性。
   Blackdevhub.io存在推进科技的黑白裔美国人民的职位，利用社区和区块科技的力量分享和创造新的机遇，想法和创新。一起，我们＆＃39;重新改变科技的面孔。
  要与Blackdevhub.io保持最新，请在Instagram和Twitter上关注我们。 
Mardochee Macxis，BlackDevhub.io，+1 910-991-0369，contact@blackdevhub.io
note_en:
CHARLOTTE, N.C.,  June 19, 2021 /PRNewswire-PRWeb/ -- As the nation prepares to celebrate Juneteenth as a federal holiday for the first time, a new frontier for diversity in tech is opening for exploration. Fortune 500 Senior Software Engineer Mardochee "Mardix" Macxis is launching BlackDevHub.io, the first Black social and job matching network built on blockchain technology.
 BlackDevHub.io offers Black and African American people in tech and hiring organizations who want to hire them a decentralized platform to build community, share job opportunities and create new applications in a free space limited only by its users' ambitions.
 BlackDevHub.io exists to solve a real problem plaguing the tech industry: lack of diversity. Despite historic interest in racial equity and inclusion at all levels of society, Black representation in tech remains low. At leading tech companies like Facebook, Google, Microsoft and Twitter, Black people make up just 3–6% of employees. And it's not for lack of desire — Black people are interested in tech, and tech companies are interested in hiring them. They just don't always know how to find each other.
  "I created BlackDevHub.io to level the playing field and bridge the gap between Black talent and employers. BlackDevHub.io splits the power evenly between Black talent and the companies who want to hire them, providing opportunity-seekers a growth-minded community and hiring managers a secure, streamlined platform to list positions and connect with incredible talent they may have otherwise missed. We can't wait to see what our users accomplish on BlackDevHub.io."
 BlackDevHub.io also makes it easier for organizations committed to diversity to showcase their efforts to the world. With its blockchain-verified Diversity Index, BlackDevHub.io ranks Fortune 500 companies for diversity in tech hires. And with corporate profile verification, community members can easily identify and connect with organizations committed to promoting greater inclusion.
   BlackDevHub.io exists to advance the positions of Black and African American people in tech, leveraging the power of community and blockchain technology to share and create new opportunities, ideas and innovations. Together, we're changing the face of tech.
  To stay up-to-date with BlackDevHub.io, follow us on  Instagram and  Twitter.
  Mardochee Macxis, BlackDevHub.io, +1 910-991-0369,  contact@blackdevhub.io
title: 第一个在BlockChain推出JuneTeN的黑人拥有的社会工作网络
title_en: The first Black-owned social job network built on blockchain launches Juneteenth

note:
普遍且流线型购物APP Nate通过叛员合作伙伴的一轮领导的一系列循环获得了3800万美元的资金，以及先行者企业和现有投资者迦南合作伙伴和衣服管理的贡献。
 纽特系列A已经完成了一年后，金融公司筹集了种子，将股权达到5100万美元。
  “我们正在充分利用，我们选择与Roseanne Wincek和Renegade团队一起使用的选择。他们的人民 - 首先是人力资本的思维和方法是令人耳目一新，并指示新一代创始人真正价值的创始人的类型。“
 Nate的管理层声称他们提供了第一个AI增强的网上购物工具，即“集中购买到一个平台上”，允许客户从任何数字商业商店获取产品，其中“单击按钮”。该公司的FINTECH应用程序作为一个封闭的社交方面的通用购物解决方案，“朋友可以互相激励”。
 Nate说，它触及了消费者的旅程“从灵感购买，并能够付款。” FINTECH公司最近推出了自己的薪酬稍后解决方案，现在计划扩大其付款产品。然而，与类似的产品不同，Nate声称它“从不妥协消费者隐私或收费商家单一的费用。”
  “在历史上第一次，购物者拥有在线购买任何东西的无缝，普遍和私人方式。我们在Nate所做的一切都是通过珍惜让我们的人，我们雇用我们设计产品的方式而导致的。“
 正如与CI共享的更新中所提到的，Nate的客户群一直在加倍“每六周”。全球数字商业市场规模价值超过4万亿美元，近1万亿美元来自美国。 
如释放所指出的，Nate用户有“从美国的所有210万个在线商店购买的能力 - 代表非亚马逊经济的长尾，占美国电子商务的60％”。
  “在增长的另一步，Nate也扩大了其董事会。在预期这一资金回合，今年早些时候该公司任命Linda Fayne Levinson作为首批独立董事。“
  “即将推出，该应用程序将推出新的社交功能。 Nate计划为创作者提供现金返还的任何购买追随者的追随者 - 这是一个能够为蓬勃发展的创造者经济货币提供权力的演变。在开发中也是一个应用程序的钱包，其中列表制作者可以节省和使用他们的奖励。“
 如发布中所述，Nate是一家基于纽约的努力支持的AI启动。它推出了第一个移动应用程序，允许用户“代表客户在任何在线零售商处购买任何物品”。
 与AI技术导航网站的方式，人类将索赔是“移动结账的唯一环球加速器”。
 致力于“保护人类的发现和灵感的道路，”Nate被设计为“一旦用户选择他们想要购买的产品，就会促进购买 - 人类决定，机器执行。”该应用程序目前可用于App Store上的移动下载。
DQ推广赞助商链接
note_en:
Universal and streamlined shopping app  nate has secured $38 million in capital through a Series A round led by  Renegade Partners, along with contributions from  Forerunner Ventures and existing investors  Canaan Partners and  Coatue Management.
 nate’s Series A has been finalized a year after the Fintech firm raised a seed round, bringing the total equity secured to date to $51 million.
  “We’re well capitalized and I couldn’t be happier with our choice to work with Roseanne Wincek and the Renegade team. Their people-first mindset and approach to human capital is refreshing and indicative of the type of venture capital that the new generation of founders like myself really value.”
 nate’s management claims they offer the first  AI-enhanced online shopping tool that “centralizes purchasing onto a single platform,” allowing clients to acquire a product from any digital commerce store with the “click of a button.” The firm’s Fintech app serves as a universal shopping solution that comes with an embedded social side, where “friends can inspire each other.”
 nate says that it touches the consumer journey “from inspiration to purchase, and enables the payment.” The Fintech firm recently introduced its own pay later solution, and now plans to  expand its line of payment products. Unlike similar products, however, nate claims that it “never compromises consumer privacy or charges merchants a single cent.”
  “For the first time in history, shoppers have a seamless, universal, and private way of buying anything online. Everything we do at nate is driven by cherishing what makes us human, from the people we hire to how we design our products.”
 As mentioned in the update shared with CI, nate’s customer base has been doubling “every six weeks.” The global digital commerce market size was valued at more than $4 trillion, nearly $1 trillion of which comes from the US.
 As noted in the release, nate users have “the ability to purchase from all 2.1 million online stores in the US — representing the long-tail of the non-Amazon economy and 60% of US e-commerce.”
  “In another step of growth, nate has also expanded its board of directors. In anticipation of this funding round, earlier this year the company appointed  Linda Fayne Levinson as its first Independent Director.”
  “Coming soon, the app will launch new social functions. nate plans to give creators cash-back for any purchases followers make from their lists – an evolution that will power the monetization of the booming creator economy. Also in development is an in-app wallet where list-makers can save and use their rewards.”
 As mentioned in the release, nate is a venture-backed AI startup based in New York. It has  introduced the first mobile app that allows users “to purchase any item at any online retailer on behalf of a customer.”
 With AI tech that navigates the web the way humans would, nate claims to be “the only universal accelerator for mobile checkout.”
 Committed to “preserving the human experience of discovery and the path to inspiration,” nate is designed “to facilitate purchases once its user has chosen the product they want to buy – humans decide, machines execute.” The app is currently available for mobile download on the App Store.
Sponsored Links by DQ Promote
title: 购物和支付稍后的App Nate，允许用户从任何电子商务商店购买产品并集中购买，提高3800万美元
title_en: Shopping and pay later app nate, which allows users to buy products from any e-commerce store and centralize their purchases, raises $38M Series A

note: 曼哈顿海滩私募股权公司K1投资管理人员在米尔波特拉斯的软件公司Eltropy Inc.Eltopt elc.Eltopt elc。elttopy提供了2100万美元的投资，提供了一个基于消息的平台，允许银行，信用处和其他金融机构通过短信与客户沟通。凭借3亿美元的K1投资，Eltropy旨在扩大其通讯套件，而不是其双倍的员工。 ＆＃34; K1很激动到与厄尔复古团队合作，因为它们改变了消费者与其金融机构的互动，＆＃34; K1副总裁Christian Grant在6月16日说公告。 ＆＃34;该公司继续看到大量的软件，在2021年5月在5月2011年的另一个记录预订，因为客户希望自动化历史手动通信和工作流任务。＆＃34;截至5月初，K1旨在为K5私人投资者筹集近40亿美元，其第五旗舰软件基金和最大迄今为止。私募股权公司的第四个基金占少于一半，金额为15亿美元。该基金投资于企业软件公司，年收入高达5000万美元。 K1公司成立于2010年，拥有150多家企业软件公司，包括项目管理软件公司克拉宁;通信和协作平台狂欢移动安全;和建筑，一个物业管理软件公司。
note_en: Manhattan Beach-based private equity firm K1 Investment Management is making a $21 million investment in Milpitas-based software company Eltropy Inc.  Eltropy offers a messaging-based platform that allows banks, credit unions and other financial institutions to communicate with customers through text messages.  With the $21 million investment from K1, Eltropy aims to expand its communication suite and more than double its employee headcount.  "K1 is thrilled to partner with the Eltropy team as they transform the way consumers interact with its financial institutions," K1 Vice President Christian Grant said in the June 16 announcement. "The company continues to see mass adoption of its software, with another record bookings month in May 2021, as customers look to automate historically manual communication and workflow tasks."  As of early May, K1 intended to raise nearly $4 billion for K5 Private Investors, its fifth flagship software fund and largest raise to date. The private equity firm’s fourth fund raised less than half that amount, at $1.5 billion. That fund invested in enterprise software companies that had an annual revenue of up to $50 million.  Founded in 2010, K1 has worked with more than 150 enterprise software companies, including project management software company Clarizen; communication and collaboration platform Rave Mobile Safety; and Buildium, a property management software company.
title: Eltropy，其套件允许金融机构通过短信与客户沟通，宣布从K1投资2100万美元作为其系列的一部分
title_en: Eltropy, whose suite allows financial institutions to communicate with customers via text messages, announces $21M investment from K1 as part of its Series A

note:
启动Brightline筹集了7200万美元，以推动其虚拟行为健康解决方案的国家扩展，专门用于支持儿童，青少年及其家庭。
   GV（以前谷歌企业）LED Brightline的B型系列，并参与新的投资者Optument，7次Wireventures和Gaingels，领先的风险投资联合支持多样性和代表LGBTQ社区和盟友。德布拉李，主席兼首席执行官Emeritus，BET网络，也为独立投资者贡献。
  返回投资者在圆周包括OAK HC / FT，阈值风险，加州的蓝色盾牌，Massachusetts的蓝色交叉蓝盾，Sempervirens VC和城市轻资本。
 该圆包括硅谷银行的700万美元的风险债务。明亮的线现在已经提高了迄今为止近1亿美元的资金。
 Brightline，以前艾米利奥医疗保健，为儿童及其家人制定了一种能够为能够为能够的行为健康住宅。根据Brightline的说法，该公司在行为健康状况飙升并对工作家庭产生不成比例的影响方面的行为健康状况的速度和对工人的生产率损失和员工造成的猖獗的生产率丧失和员工进行员工的影响。
  根据人口普查局的数据，约有1000万岁的美国母亲与学龄儿童的母亲居住在2021年的校龄儿童的初期没有工作，比上年增加了140万美元。
 BrightLine对工作父母和护理人员的自身调查发现，50％的人报告称，在照顾孩子的行为健康需求的工作中失去了显着的生产力。 
据Brightline高管表示，需要进行以家庭为导向的解决方案来提供行为保健服务。
 “在过去的一年里，各地的家庭都感受到了大流行对他们的孩子和日常生活的影响。我们看到更多的儿童，青少年和青少年，而不是以前与行为健康挑战 - 现在是我们在需要领先于未来的需要的时候，“Naomi Allen，Brightline Ceo和联合创始人在一份声明中说。 “我们很幸运能够在GV和我们所有的投资者中拥有令人难以置信的合作伙伴，他们加入了我们在儿童和家庭的生活中有所作为。最新的资金将使我们能够更快地创新，迅速扩大，帮助更多的儿童和家庭获得应得的照顾。“
 据该公司称，Brightline将使用现金输液来扩展其全国范围内的虚拟护理，以推动公司＆＃39;由于该公司的领先国家雇主和主要卫生计划为其伴侣提供了对家庭的行为健康支持。
 “CDC数据显示，5中的美国儿童估计有1例精神或行为健康状况，但80％不会得到他们需要的照顾。 “小儿行为医疗保健通常不太可达，而不是对成年人的关心，”GV罗宾斯（Ben Robbins）表示，在GV董事会加入Brightline的董事会。 “Brightline解决了儿科行为健康服务的巨大未满足需求，并且在患者和家庭的需求基础上提供多种级别的护理。”
 Livongo创始人Glen Tullman，现任Transcarent and Managing合作伙伴的首席执行官，7名Wireventures，以及Laura Veroneau，Optum Ventures的合作伙伴，正在加入Brightline作为董事会观察员。
 BrightLine还宣布他们正在开始最大的扩张迄今为止，并在全国范围内推出新产品，并向新州扩展临床服务。
 在2019年推出，Brightline＆＃39; S平台提供多学科护理团队，以家庭为重点的方法和基于证据的护理，以及创新的技术，Brightline能够以任何挑战为主的家庭。 
远程医疗帮助使精神保健更容易通过消除往返以及经常预约的一些物流负担来获得儿童。
  数字健康市场中有一些儿科初创性初创公司。 Hazel Health在学校护士内部经营虚拟护理诊所和办公室，通过远程健康将学生连接到医生，最近降落了3300万美元的资金。萌芽，一种技术化的自闭症护理和治疗计划，于7月推出，在种子资金1000万美元的后面推出。
 黎明健康是另一个初创公司试图解决孩子心理保健中的差距。该公司于2020年2月推出，专门提供在线咨询服务，特别是青少年。
 Brighline推出了全国可用性的新产品，并正在向新州扩展临床服务。本夏天将在今年夏天提供家庭和第39页的Connect功能，提供家庭访问个性化内容和提示，互动练习和与支援的教练聊天的能力。
 今年夏天，Brightline Coaching功能也在全国范围内扩大，提供了行为健康教练支持的家庭，以帮助应力，焦虑，组织技能，发脾气，破坏性行为和社会情感学习等问题。
 该公司表示，截至2021年底，全国范围内提供奖金护理，以支持国家雇主和卫生计划。 Brightline的临床服务 - 包括行为治疗，药物支持和语音治疗 - 现在可以在加利福尼亚和马萨诸塞州提供，七月与华盛顿发射，几个州即将推出。 Brightline希望将这些服务扩展到全部50个州，到今年年底。
note_en:
Startup Brightline scored $72 million to fuel the national expansion of its virtual behavioral health solution designed specifically to support children, teenagers, and their families.
   GV (formerly Google Ventures) led Brightline’s series B round, with participation from new investors Optum Ventures, 7wireVentures, and Gaingels, the leading venture investment syndicate in support of diversity and representing the LGBTQ community and allies. Debra Lee, chairman and CEO Emeritus, BET Networks, also contributed to the round as an independent investor.
  Returning investors in the round include Oak HC/FT, Threshold Ventures, Blue Shield of California, Blue Cross Blue Shield of Massachusetts, SemperVirens VC and City Light Capital.
 The round includes $7 million of venture debt from Silicon Valley Bank. Brightline has now raised a total of nearly $100 million in funding to date.
 Brightline, formerly Emilio Healthcare, developed a technology-enabled behavioral health home for children and their families. The company's growth comes at a time when rates of behavioral health conditions are skyrocketing across the country and having a disproportionate impact on working families—leading to rampant productivity loss and employees leaving the paid workforce in droves, according to Brightline.
  Around 10 million American mothers living with their school-age children were not working at the start of 2021, a 1.4 million increase over the previous year, according to data from the Census Bureau.
 Brightline’s own survey of working parents and caregivers found that 50% reported losing significant productivity at work in caring for their children’s behavioral health needs.
 There is a need for family-oriented solutions to deliver behavioral health care services, according to Brightline executives.
 “In the past year, families everywhere have felt the impact of the pandemic on their children and daily lives. We’re seeing more children, adolescents, and teens than ever with behavioral health challenges—now is the time for us to get ahead of the coming wave of need,” said Naomi Allen, Brightline CEO and co-founder in a statement. “We are fortunate to have incredible partners in GV and all of our investors who joined us to make a difference in the lives of children and families. The latest funding will allow us to innovate even more quickly, expand rapidly, and help more children and families get the care they deserve.”
 Brightline will use the cash infusion to scale its virtual care across the country—fueling the company's growth as it partner with leading national employers and major health plans to bring behavioral health support to families, according to the company.
 “CDC data shows that an estimated 1 in 5 U.S. children has a diagnosed mental or behavioral health condition—yet 80% will not get the care they need. Pediatric behavioral health care is often less accessible and comprehensive than care for adults,” said Ben Robbins, psychiatrist and venture partner at GV who is joining Brightline’s board of directors. “Brightline addresses the huge unmet need of pediatric behavioral health services and is uniquely positioned to provide multiple levels of care based on the needs of patients and families.”
 Livongo founder Glen Tullman, now CEO of Transcarent and managing partner at 7wireVentures, and Laura Veroneau, partner at Optum Ventures, are joining Brightline as board observers.
 Brightline also announced that they are embarking on their biggest expansion to date, introducing new products with nationwide availability and expanding clinical services to new states.
 Launched in 2019, Brightline's platform offers multidisciplinary care teams, a family-focused approach and evidence-based care delivery, and innovative technology, Brightline is able to support families with whatever challenges they're facing.
 Telehealth helps to make mental health care easier to access for kids by doing away with some of the logistical burdens of getting to and from frequent appointments.
  There are a few pediatric startups making inroads in the digital health market. Hazel Health operates virtual care clinics inside the school nurse's office to connect students to a physician via telehealth and recently landed a $33 million funding round. Sprout, a tech-enabled autism care and treatment program, launched in July on the back of $10 million in seed funding.
 Daybreak Health is another startup trying to tackle the gaps in mental health care for kids. The company launched in February 2020 and specializes in providing online counseling services, especially for teens.
 Brighline has launched new products with nationwide availability and is expanding clinical services to new states. The company's Connect feature, which provides families access to personalized content and tips, interactive exercises and the ability to chat with a coach for support, will be available nationwide this summer.
 The Brightline Coaching feature also expands nationwide this summer, which provides families with support from behavioral health coaches to help with issues like stress, anxiety, organizational skills, tantrums, disruptive behavior and social-emotional learning.
 Brightline Care will be available nationwide by the end of 2021 to support national employers and health plans, the company said. Brightline’s clinical services—including behavior therapy, medication support, and speech therapy—are now available in California and Massachusetts, with Washington launching in July and several more states coming soon. Brightline expects to expand these services to all 50 states by the end of this year.
title: 为儿童和青少年提供虚拟行为健康疗法的Brightline培养了GV的7200万系列B，使其总量升至〜100米
title_en: Brightline, which provides virtual behavioral health therapy for children and teenagers, raises $72M Series B led by GV, bringing its total raised to ~$100M
